title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 May 2015 - XWiki
content:
has joined #xwiki 02:33  has quit 06:00  has joined #xwiki 06:03  has quit 06:51  has joined #xwiki 07:07  has quit 07:13  has joined #xwiki 07:39  has joined #xwiki 08:15  has joined #xwiki 08:17  has joined #xwiki 08:27  has quit 08:39  has joined #xwiki 08:53  has joined #xwiki 08:54  has quit 08:55  has joined #xwiki 09:03  has joined #xwiki 09:06  has joined #xwiki 09:07  has joined #xwiki 09:07  has quit 09:11  has joined #xwiki 09:39  has joined #xwiki 09:44  has joined #xwiki 09:47  has joined #xwiki 09:59  has joined #xwiki 10:03  has quit 10:17  has joined #xwiki 10:17  Hi all, 10:19  I've performed a "sanity check" and i've many errors. There is some explanations how to fix it, in a docs somewhere 10:21  has joined #xwiki 10:21  has joined #xwiki 10:23  has joined #xwiki 10:27  has joined #xwiki 10:29  has quit 10:30  any idea cjd or vmassol ? 10:52  has quit 11:12  has joined #xwiki 11:19  has joined #xwiki 11:51  has quit 12:38  has quit 12:52  has joined #xwiki 12:53  has quit 13:01  has joined #xwiki 13:02  has quit 13:06  has quit 13:12  has quit 13:18  has joined #xwiki 13:20  has joined #xwiki 13:55  has quit 13:59  has joined #xwiki 14:08  has joined #xwiki 14:14  Hello, I tried to upgrade my xwiki from 6.4 to 7.01 but the DW is angry and don't want install XWiki UI 7.0.1 because invalid version! Here a nice screenshot: http://snag.gy/RAswO.jpg  I wonder if I must upgrade to 7.0 before ? Thxs 14:15  (I'm behind an http proxy) 14:17  Pbas: you have something weird in your installation, how did you upgraded the WAR ? according to the error you seems to still have 6.4 jars in there 14:17  as you you had merged 7.0.1 and 6.4 WARs or something like this 14:18  s/as you/as if/ 14:18  I keep data on filesystem and same postgres datbase, replace WAR file, delete cache and restart tomcat 14:19  well XWiki definitely found xwiki-platform-legacy-rendering-macro-include jar in 6.4 version 14:19  you should probably check what you have exactly in WEB-INF/lib 14:19  Perhaps it is extension file in my environment.permanentDirectory ? 14:19  no 14:19  as indicated in the error this is a core extension 14:20  Ok I wil check jars 14:20  meaning a WAR jar 14:20  or a jar coming from the application server but in this jar case I doubt it 14:22  Nope: /tomcat-7.0.47/webapps# find xwiki/WEB-INF/ -name \*-6.4\* didn't find any files 14:23  I didn't merge war (I replace it by the new one) 14:25  DW indicate                         Dependency  [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-include-7.0.1] is not  compatible with core extension  [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-legacy-rendering-macro-include-6.4]                    class org.xwiki.extension.InstallException: Failed to resolve extension 14:26  but I haven't \*acy-rendering-macro-include-6.4 file anymore (but I modified templates/macros.vm) 14:30  I must delete /home/data\_xwiki/cache/extension/core/\*.xed files in my permanentDirectory ? 14:31  because I have #-# Indicate if the rendering cache is enabled. 14:31  #-# Default value is false. 14:31  core.renderingcache.enabled=true 14:44  XWiki does not load core extensions from /home/data\_xwiki/cache/extension/core/, this folder is used only to get details about found extensions 14:44  Ok thxs ... I'm searching ... 14:44  deleting it and restart will not harm anyway 14:45  sure :-) 14:45  if it fix your issue I will have to try to reproduce it 14:45  ok 14:46  but if that was the issue pretty much everyone would have this issue all the time 14:47  ... if they use cache rendering set to true 14:49  ... waiting ... and... 14:51  yes! :) 14:51  I'm on "these extensions will be upgraded" 14:52  What I've done to fix it: 14:55  Stop tomcat, delete (rename) /cache/extension/core subdirectory, modify xwiki.properties core.renderingcache.enabled=false (it is default value), clear work/temp of tomcat, restart tomcat  and waiting. 14:56  more exactly relaunch xwiki DW 14:56  there is no relation between /cache/extension/core  and core.renderingcache.enabled properties 14:56  core.renderingcache.enabled is about rendering, not exensions 14:56  it is an x file case? 14:57  then one operation fix my problem 14:58  has quit 14:58  hi Pbas, long time no talk. How is XWiki going in your company? :) Good, I hope! 14:58  it's not core.renderingcache.enabled for sure since it's not used in your case 14:59  hé hé not for the moment :-)) 14:59  (i'm less present on irc these days since i can only type with one hand - broke the other one) 14:59  not == not going well? that's sad 14:59  but having 6.4 stuff in cache/extension/core is something anyone upgrading from 6.4 to anything else have and there has been plenty of upgrades like this without any report (I did several myself) so I don't understand how to reproduce your issue 15:00  If you want I can retry some test 15:00  more seriously vincent my boss is enjoy with xwiki and my xwiki application 15:00  oh that's nice to hear :) say hello to your boss from me btw! 15:00  xwiki is great powerfull and "maléable à volonté simpleùment" 15:00  hehe indeed 15:00  np 15:01  Pbas: not sure what test to make you do 15:01  rename cache folder and retry (because I didn't going foward in DW) 15:01  if you can go back to the previous state maybe sending me a copy of your WAR so that I try to reproduce 15:02  you already have WAR file because it is yours (I didn't modify this one execpt some template file) 15:02  I meant your install, with the core extension cache etc 15:03  i.e. having the same things and see what is happening during core extension scanning to end up with this 6.4 core extension 15:03  unless you can put some breakpoing yourself and I can give you some point on where to look at 15:03  \*breakpoints 15:03  ho sorry abourt your arm vincent . Is it on tennis ? My son broke his finger on tennis too :-/ 15:04  Pbas: not tennis… simply fell while playing with my kids on the beach :) 15:05  Ho happy to see than you disconnect of xwiki sometimes to see reallife :-D but like you see real life is dangerous! 15:05  hehe 15:05  yup too dangerous! 15:05  https://twitter.com/vmassol/status/593067895992745984 15:05  has joined #xwiki 15:06  nice puppet :-) 15:06  :) 15:11  tmortagne: shouldn't author be mandatory in the repo app? 15:11  (I can create a jira) 15:12  by default your are set as author 15:12  hmm so he removed it voluntarily 15:12  so to not have one you need to explicitly remove yourself 15:12  but sure we can probably also add a validation 15:12  ok I'll create a jira for now 15:12  is it an import or a creation ? 15:13  don't know 15:13  just noticed that http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/RepairWikiLinks was missing an author 15:13  it's possible an import of a maven project without any author ends up with no author in e.x.o. 15:13  it's not synced 15:13  so not import 15:13  not an import 15:13  since the download is an attachment 15:14  the category should be application for this ext no? 15:14  or do we need another category for tools? 15:17  tmortagne: trying to build oldcore I get: 15:17  Failed tests: 15:17    TemplateManagerTest.testRenderWiki:133 expected:<[

first line
second line

]> but was:<[]> 15:19  vmassol: this test is ok for me and for jenkins it seems, don't have much idea of what could make this fail a recent commit I would have done 15:20  I pulled and tried to build oldcore 15:20  trying in ide 15:22  ok works in ide 15:22  will run with -U 15:26  works 15:27  looking at recent failure in jenkins, two of them might be related to my last commit 15:29  has quit 15:33  tmortagne: should we have an API category for JAR extensions? 15:33  (on exo) 15:35  did not really gave much tough on a exhaustive list of categories yet but I don't think all JAR are of category "API", you jar can be many things (a macro, a renderer, etc) 15:35  sure but API sounds like one we should propose 15:35  along with Macro 15:36  is this specific to exo or should I add those in the repo app? 15:37  repo app is fine IMO 15:37  ok adding those 2 to both places 15:37  I doubt there will be much exo specific categories 15:40  tmortagne: hmmm I can't change the category from http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Extension/HPQC+Macro?editor=inline 15:40  is that normal? 15:40  it should be defined in the pom I guess 15:41  it's an imported extension 15:41  hmm so we need to update the contrib guide 15:41  since that's part of the field that are imported it's disabled form imported extensions 15:42  and we need to set categories for all platform extensions too 15:42  but we need to upgrade xwiki.org since right now those category are not really used 15:42  it's just the UI, the code handling import and REST for those is not here 15:42  what's the format? 15:42  (for the pom) 15:43  like usual xwiki.extension.category 15:43  and then the id right? 15:43  like "application" and not "Application" 15:44  see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Commons+-+Extension+-+Repository+-+Maven#HCustomproperties 15:44  yes the id 15:44  copy paste :) 15:44  sorry ... a friend in my office. Then "bon rétablissement" Vincent I suppose 3 or 6 week. 15:44  in the Repo app you then have a pretty name associated to the id 15:45  (for "known" categories of course) 15:45  tmortagne: I try to reproduce my problem 15:45  Pbas: thanks 3 more weeks, already did 3 15:45  fixing tmortagne 15:45  yes bad copy/paste 15:46  but generally speaking it's always the same thing, xwiki.extension. 15:51  Test 1:  cache/extension/core of 6.4 version and core.renderingcache.enabled=true DW=> "Dependency  [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-include-7.0.1] is not  compatible with core extension  [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-legacy-rendering-macro-include-6.4] " 16:00  Test 2:  cache/extension/core of 6.4 version and core.renderingcache.enabled  commented (false value), DW => Dependency  [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-include-7.0.1] is not  compatible with core extension  [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-legacy-rendering-macro-include-6.4]                    class org.xwiki.extension.InstallException: Failed to resolve extension 16:02  Enygma`: could you fix the description for http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Watchlist+API ? 16:03  so, should http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/RepairWikiLinks be in the "application" category or not? 16:03  vmassol: ok, I`ll add an extension name to replace the maven module`s description 16:04  description, not name :) 16:04  thanks 16:04   16:05  right 16:07  you could add the category at the same time ;) 16:07  (see mail) 16:08  we need to do that for all our modules now... 16:09  has quit 16:12  tmortagne: you should update the screenshot of http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Repository+Application now that you've added categories 16:12  (and ratings) 16:12  Test 3: I remove /cache/extension/core and DW working well now :-) I can't explain it  tmortague but if a user encoutered same problem, just remove this subdirectory. Do you want a jira bug or not? 16:16  Notice: I added the helloworld listener and my catalina.out containe this line: "[XWiki initialization] WARN  .o.i.DefaultObservationManager - The [com.sun.proxy.$Proxy109] listener is overwritting a previously registered listener [com.sun.proxy.$Proxy105] since they both are registered under the same id [helloworld]. In the future consider removing a Listener first if you really want to register it again. " may be it is the problem... 16:31  Pbas: sure a jira issue would be nice, if it also detail a way to reproduce it with jetty/hsqldb standard distribution even nicer :) 16:51  has joined #xwiki 16:53  Hi all. We are migrating the jira.xwiki.org server. This will cause a downtime for at least 1h, depending on how the migration goes. 16:59  has quit 17:19  has quit 17:21  has joined #xwiki 17:33  has quit 17:45  has quit 17:59  has joined #xwiki 18:09  has joined #xwiki 18:35  is now known as 18:35  has quit 18:35  has quit 18:36  has joined #xwiki 18:42  has quit 18:51  The JIRA is up again and should be functional. Please report any issue. 18:51  thanks 19:00  thanks 19:02  has quit 19:10  has quit 19:11  has quit 19:12  has quit 19:23  has joined #xwiki 19:44  has joined #xwiki 19:48  has quit 19:55  has joined #xwiki 20:04  has quit 20:19  has quit 20:26  has joined #xwiki 20:30  has quit 20:38  has joined #xwiki 20:56  has quit 21:12  has quit 21:49  has quit 22:11  has joined #xwiki 22:14  has joined #xwiki 22:15  Hey all 22:16  has quit 22:18  I'm having trouble upgrading from xwiki 6.0.1 to the newest 7 milestone 2. I am getting 404 errors on different pages stating that require.min.js is not found 22:18  Looking closer, it shows the generated URL is //webjars/requirejs/2.1.15/require.min.js 22:19  I was looking around and found out that that URL is being generated by $services.webjars.url('requirejs', "require$jsExtension") 22:19  However, I'm not sure how to fix the URL so that it loads a resource that actually exists 22:20  I tried setting xwiki.home to the correct hostname, and I also set xwiki.webapppath=, because I am running xwiki as ROOT in my tomcat instance 22:20  However no matter what I change in xwiki.cfg, it doesn't appear to make a difference to the URL 22:20  Does anyone have any guidance on this problem? 23:09  has quit 23:11  has quit 23:11  has joined #xwiki 23:38  has quit
